owl:Ontology.dc:contributor: Oscar Corcho (Universidad Politécnica de Madrid) http://orcid.org/0000-0002-9260-0753
owl:Ontology.dc:creator: POSTDATA Project “This project has received funding from the European Research Council (ERC) under the European Union’s Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme (grant agreement Nº [679528])”
owl:Ontology.dc:description: This ontology is the core of the POSTDATA network of ontologies. As such, it contains the most relevant classes and properties that allow representing poetic works and their characteristics. Besides, it contains common classes and properties that are used in many other ontologies in the network, such as those related to the representation of persons, organisations, events, places and roles that persons and organisations play in poetic works.
owl:Ontology.dc:title: POSTDATA core ontology
owl:Ontology.terms:publisher: POSTDATA Project “This project has received funding from the European Research Council (ERC) under the European Union’s Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme (grant agreement Nº [679528])” Principal Investigator. Elena González Blanco -- <https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0448-1812> Technical Director. Salvador Ros Muñoz -- <https://orcid.org/0000-0001-6330-4958>

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Level of education of the creator of a text/song. This property has as Domain PoeticWork and not Person since the education level of a person changes during time. That is, this is the education level of the author in the moment of writing the poem.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: author Education Level

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Date of birth
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: birthDate

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property points to the Place which is the provenance of the current instance of Person
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: birth Place

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Certainty of the date of birth of a Person
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: birth Place Certainty

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property points to a Person who was born in the Place
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: birth Place Of

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Level of confidence regarding the correspondent function
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: certainty

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property points to the text in which the current instance of Person or Organisation is a character.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: character In

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property points to a date entity, which represents a particular point or period of time at which something happened or existed, or is expected to happen
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: date

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Date of death
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: deathDate

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property points to the instance of Place where the Person died
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: death Place

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property points to a Person who died in the current instance of Place
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: death Place Of

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property points to a Person to whom the current text was dedicated. This means that a Redaction includes a dedicated text to another person in an explicit way (frequently at the beginning of the text).
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: dedicated To

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property points to the work (instance of PoeticWork) or a redaction which depicts the Role at hand in relation to its contents. When the Role at hand is related to the agents that participated in the transmission of the work (e.g. sponsor), this property points to the entity affected by the current function
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: depicted In

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property points to the specific Location in a bibliographic item that contains an edition of the current instance of Redaction.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: edited In

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property points to an instance of Redaction which was edited by the the current Person
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: editor Of

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property points to the container (an instance of Redaction) of which the item at hand is its first part
first Part of
The period of activity of a person, used when a range cannot be established (e.g. “3rd century”)
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: floruit

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The gender of a Person
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: gender

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Type of art, literature or music characterized by a specific form, content and style
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: genre

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property points to a character depicted in the text of a Redaction, if any. The character is an instance of Agent (Organisation or Person).
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has Character

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property points to the entity Creator that has created the current work under analysis
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has Creator

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property points to the text (an instance of Redaction) which was dedicated to the current Person.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has Dedication

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property points to the Person who has edited the current instance of Redaction
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has Editor

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property points to the first text unit which form the current element under analysis
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has First Part

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property points to a Person that belongs to the Organisation
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has Member

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: List of text units that form the Redaction
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has Ordered Text Unit List

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property points to the Place which is the provenance of the current instance of Ensemble or Poetic Work
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has Provenance

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property points to one of the texts (an instance of Redaction) which is an analytical version of the text at hand (the current Redaction)
has Synthesis
A text unit in an ordered list.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasTextUnit

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property points to another work (an instance of Redaction) which is a translation of this one
This property points to the specific location in a bibliographic item (an instance of Location) which contains a translation of the text at hand
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has Translation

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property points to an Organisation, Person or Place which are related to the current instance of Event
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: involves

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property points to the Place which is the provenance of the item
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is From

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property points to the specific location in the text of the bibliographic item (an instance of Location) in which the current text (Redaction) is indexed.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is Indexed In

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property points to the Event in which the current instance of Organisation, Person or Place is referenced
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is Involved In

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property points to the instance of Organisation to which the Person at hand belongs
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is Member Of

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property points to the text (an instance of Redaction) that records the current item (Event, Place, Organization or Person) under analysis
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is Mentioned In

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property points to the Entity whose provenance corresponds to the current instance of Place
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is Provenance For

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property points to a text (an instance of Redaction) which is one of the materialisations of the work under analysis
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is Realised Through

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property points to the specific location in the text of the bibliographic item (an instance of Location) that registers the current event
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is Recorded By

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property points to the specific location in a bibliographic item (an instance of Location) whose contents are related to the current item under analysis (usually, its specific bibliography)
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is Referenced In

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property points to another text (an instance of Redaction) of which this version (Redaction) is a synthesis
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is Synthesis Of

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property points to another version (an instance of Redaction) of which this one is a translation
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is Translation Of

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Label of a time frame for grouping certain works. Cf. "school". The values of this property are defined in a controlled vocabulary about literary periods.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: literary Period

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property points to an instance of Event or Person or Organisation or Place that is referred in a given Redaction
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: mentions

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Major literary genre of a Poetic Work, that is, drama or poetry. The values of this property are defined in a controlled vocabulary about poetic types
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: poetic Type

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property points to the work (an instance of Poetic Work) of which the text at hand (the current Redaction) is a materialisation
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: realises

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Association of a person with a religion, denomination or sub–denominational religious group. The values of this property are defined in a controlled vocabulary about religious affiliation
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: religious Affiliation

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property points to the specific location in a bibliographic item (an instance of Location) which contains the edition used as the base of text at hand
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: retrieves Text

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Specific function performed by some agent on a work (e.g. sponsor, actor, collector, singer, arranger, transcriptor). This is connected to the Role class.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: role Function

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Literary movement/school of a Person
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: school

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The social status of the Person, that is the position or rank of a Person within the society. The values are specified in a controlled vocabulary
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: social Status

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Type of character (eg. “main”, “antagonist”, etc.). The values are specified in a controlled vocabulary
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: type Of Character

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Type of designation/name. E.g. pseudonym, heteronym, allonym, orthonym variant
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: type Of Designation

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The type of textual element (e.g. part of a greater ensemble; part of a composed collection of poems; prologue of a work; epilogue of a work; a chapter of a work...)
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: type Of Textual Element

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
A file (XML, PFD, plain text) which contains the Redaction and, likely, other type of analytical information.
Taking as example the poem "Amadís de Gaula a Don Quijote de la Mancha": Redaction could be an XML-TEI file (for example, the TEI annotated text of ADSO corpus (https://github.com/bncolorado/CorpusSonetosSigloDeOro/blob/master/Cervantes/Cervantes_1.xml)), whereas "additionalFile" could be another file containing a plain text version of the same poem.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: additional File

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
An additional name, such as a nickname, epithet, or alias, or any other descriptive phrase used within a personal name.
Taking as example the writer Charlotte Brontë, an "additionalName" would be her alias: "Currell Bell".
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: additional Name

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
Contains a postal address, for example of a publisher, an organisation, or an individual. There can only be one address per Organization.
Taking as example Cervantes' poem "Amadís de Gaula a Don Quijote de la Mancha", TEI-annotated in the ADSO corpus, the publisher would be "Natural Language Processing Group. Department of Software and Computing Systems. University of Alicante (Spain)", and its address would be "carretera San Vicente s/n 03690 San Vicente del Raspeig, Alicante (Spain)".
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: address

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
Alternative name that references the current Person. A person may have zero or several alternative names.
Taking as example the character "Aldonza Lorenzo" from the Quixote, an "alternativeName" could be "Dulcinea".
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: alternative Name

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
Alternative title, that is, other known denominations of a Poetic Work or a Redaction.
Taking as example the "Poema de Mio Cid", an "alternativeTitle" would be "Cantar de Mio Cid".
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: alternative Title

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
The meant readership, viewers or listeners of a cultural product (Redaction). There is at most one possible value for audience.
Taking as example the play "La segunda Celestina", "audience" would be the Spanish Queen and the people in the court attending the Queen's birthday celebrations.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: audience

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
Level of education of the recipients of a text/song.
Taking as example the play "La segunda Celestina" (Agustín de Salazar), "audienceEducationLevel" would be a learned audience.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: audience Education Level

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
An account of a person's life written, composed, or produced by another.
Taking as example the poet Antonio Machado, "biography" could be: "Antonio Cipriano José María y Francisco de Santa Ana Machado y Ruiz (26 July 1875 – 22 February 1939), known as Antonio Machado, was a Spanish poet and one of the leading figures of the Spanish literary movement known as the Generation of '98. His work, initially modernist, evolved towards an intimate form of symbolism with romantic traits. He gradually developed a style characterised by both an engagement with humanity on one side and an almost Taoist contemplation of existence on the other, a synthesis that according to Machado echoed the most ancient popular wisdom. In Gerardo Diego's words, Machado "spoke in verse and lived in poetry."" (example extracted from Wikipedia).
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: biography

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
An explanatory series of notes or comments; an explanatory essay or treatise on a text.
Taking as Opus example "Versos" by Fernando de Herrera, the comments Francisco de Quevedo wrote on his own edition along the text of the poems would form the "commentary".
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: commentary

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
An ethnic group; a social group that shares a common and distinctive culture, religion, language, or the like.
Taking as Person example the poet "Antonio Enríquez Gómez", his "ethnicity" would be "crypto-Jewish".
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: ethnicity

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
Text that narrates an Event, that is, an excerpt of the Redaction. There is at most one possible description for this property.
Taking as Opus example the "Poema de Mio Cid", and as Event example the Cid's arrival to Burgos, we find an "eventNarration" in lines 1-64, starting with "De los sos ojos tan fuertemientre llorando".
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: event Narration

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
The closing words of the composition (usually, the last verse). There is only one explicit per Redaction.
Taking as example the poem "Canary" by Rita Dove, the last verse, "If you can't be free, be a mystery", would be the "explicit".
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: explicit

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
It contains a forename, given or baptismal name.
Taking as example the poet "Antonio Machado", his "forename" would be "Antonio".
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: forename

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
Purpose of the work (e.g. prayer, spell, curse). A Poetic Work or Redaction may have several functions associated.
Taking as example the poem "Cantico delle creature" by San Francesco d’Assisi, "function" would be "prayer".
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: function

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
It contains a name component used to distinguish otherwise similar names on the basis of the relative ages or generations of the persons named.
Taking as example the person "Felipe II", "genName" is "II".
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: genName

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
The first line of the work. There is one incipit for each Redaction.
Taking as example the "Soledades" by Góngora, the "incipit" is "Pasos de un peregrino son errante".
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: incipit

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
In case the identity of current instance of Creator is unknown.
Taking as example the creator of "Libro de Alexandre", "isAnonymous" is True because the author is unknown to this day.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: is Anonymous

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
Whether it is a calligram, that is, a text visually arranged in a way that it forms an image associated with the text contents.
Taking as example the (calligram) poem "La Colombe poignardée et le Jet d’eau" by Apollinaire, "is Calligram" value is True.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: is Calligram

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
Whether the person under analysis is a fictional character.
Taking as example the character "Don Quijote de la Mancha" will have a True value for "is Fictional" property.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: is Fictional

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
Whether the Redaction was composed to be sung.
Taking as example the poetic work "Chanson de Roland", "is Song" is True because the work is part of a genre which was sang.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: is Song

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
In case the identity of the current instance of Creator is certainly a wrong attribution. This is applied to the Creator Role associated to a Redaction.
Taking as example the poem "Muere lentamente" (by Martha Madeiros) which is erroneously attributed to Pablo Neruda, in the case Neruda is indicated as the author, "is Wrong Attribution" would be True.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: is Wrong Attribution

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
A significant or descriptive word. Usually, a word used as a reference point for finding other words or information.
Taking as example the theatre play "Othello" by Shakespeare, one possible "keyword" is "jealousy".
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: keyword

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
Language of the text. There might be several languages used in a Poetic Work or Redaction.
For example the "language" of "Romancero gitano" by Lorca, is "Spanish" (xsd:string). It could also be represented with the associated langauge code "es" (xsd:language)
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: language

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
The arrangement of textual materials (images included) on a page.
Taking as example "The Waste Land and Other Poems" by T.S. Eliot, edition by Broadview press, printed in 2011, the "the layout" can be described in the following way: "the text is left aligned, written in one column. Each stanza is followed by a blank space dividing it from the following stanza. The number of lines is displayed by a number marking every five lines which is aligned to the right edge of the page. Every page contains on average 30-40 lines".
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: layout

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
The literary tradition assigned to a Poetic Work. There might be several values for this property.
Taking as example the theatre play "La vida es sueño" by Calderón de la Barca, "literary Tradition" is "Baroque".
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: literary Tradition

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
Contains a proper noun or noun phrase that refers the current item.
Taking as example the full name of Federico García Lorca, "name" would be "Federico del Sagrado Corazón de Jesús García Lorca".
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: name

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
A connecting phrase or link used within a name but not regarded as part of it.
Taking as example the writer “Hildegard von Bingen”, her “nameLink” would be “von”.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: name Link

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
Location of the narrative. There is at most one possible location for a Redaction or Poetic Work.
Taking as example the poem “Cantar de Mio Cid”, the “narrativeLocation” would be “Spain”.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: narrative Location

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
An ethnic group forming a part of one or more political nations.
Taking as example, the poet “Antonio Machado”, his “nationality” would be “Spanish”.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: nationality

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Comment or explanation referred to a Place, Poetic Work, Redaction or Person
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: note

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Number of total lines comprising the Ensemble
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: number of Lines

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Number of plays of an Ensemble
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: number of Plays

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Number of poems of an Ensemble
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: number of poems

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Number of Primary Sources used in the elaboration of an edition (Redaction)
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: number of Witnesses Used

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The language from which the Redaction is a translation
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: original Language

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Name of the place as it appears in the source text
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: original Name

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The identifying name of a Redaction or Poetic Work as it appears in its primary source. There is at most one possible original title.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: original Title

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The recasting of the contents in words different from that originally used, whether in the same language or in a translation. A Redaction may have zero or one paraphrasis associated.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: paraphrasis

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A fictitious name, especially a pen name. A variant name
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: pen Name

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: URL to a digital image file that depicts the person
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: portrait

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Contains a name component which indicates that the referent has a particular role or position in society, such as an official title or rank
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: position Name

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Excerpt
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: sample Text

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Note about the source used to give a particular piece of information
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: source Note

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A secondary, usually explanatory title
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: subtitle

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Contains a family (inherited) name, as opposed to a given, baptismal, or nick name
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: surname

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Reference to textual contents . The contents of this property do not allow finer analysis by stanza or line. It can be a text of a diplomatic edition, semidiplomatic edition or of a critical edition (among others) or even a translation. The property typeOfRedaction defines the type of Edition or if it is a translation. There is only one possible text for each Redaction.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: text

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Subject of a Poetic Work
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: theme

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Type of event, for instance its modality (real, fictional...)
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: type of Event

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Type of place (e.g. fictional)
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: type of Place

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The type of the text provided in the Redaction Eg.: Diplomatic edition, critical edition, translation
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: type of Redaction

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: There are references that mentioned a PrimarySource for the text at hand but the real textual artefact has not been identified
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: unidentified Source

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Primary sources of the text excluded during the elaboration of a Redaction (usually, dependent witnesses)
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: unused Witnesses

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Number that identifies the Redaction inside a collection. There can only be one value associated for each Redaction.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: work Number

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Any additional information that can help the reader. The first word should be capitalized.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: has note

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A secondary title that follows the main title of a work.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: has subtitle

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: An extended description or account of someone's life.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: Biography

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A name for some thing.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: name

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The latitude of a location. For example 37.42242 (WGS 84).
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: latitude

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The longitude of a location. For example -122.08585 (WGS 84).
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: longitude

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This class comprises the sums of concepts which appear in the course of the coherent evolution of an original idea into one or more expressions that are dominated by the original idea. The substance of Work is concepts. A Work may be elaborated by one or more Actors simultaneously or over time. A Work may have members that constitute components of the overall concept or that are alternatives to other members of the work. Members of a work may or may not represent the concept of the Work as a whole; for instance a translation reinterprets the whole, a volume of a trilogy represents a part of the concept. A Work can be either individual or complex. If it is individual its concept is completely realised in a single F22 Self-Contained Expression. If it is complex its concept is embedded in an F15 Complex Work. An F15 Complex Work consists of members that are either F15 Complex Works themselves or F14 Individual Works. The member relationship of Work is based on the members respecting the same concept, and should not be confused with the structural parts of an expression, that might be taken from other work(s). A Work is the product of an intellectual process of one or more persons, yet only indirect evidence about it is at our hands. This can be contextual information such as the existence of an order for a work, reflections of the creators themselves that are documented somewhere, and finally the expressions of the work created. As ideas normally take shape during discussion, elaboration and implementation, it is not reasonable to assume that a work starts with a complete concept. Moreover, it can be very difficult or impossible to define the whole of the concept of a work at some given time. The only objective evidence for such a notion can be based on a stage of expressions at a given time. In this sense, self-contained expressions serve as a kind of "snap-shots" of a work. A Work may aggregate expressions of other works into a new expression. For instance, an anthology of poems is regarded as a work in its own right that makes use of expressions of the individual poems that have been selected and ordered as part of an intellectual process. This does not make the contents of the aggregated expressions part of this work, but only parts of the resulting expression.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Work
owl:Class.skos:definition: This class comprises the sums of concepts which appear in the course of the coherent evolution of an original idea into one or more expressions that are dominated by the original idea.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This class comprises works whose essence is the selection and/or arrangement of expressions of one or more other works. This does not make the contents of the aggregated expressions part of this work, but only part of the resulting expression. F17 Aggregation Work may include additional original parts. An expression of a work may include expressions of other works within it. For instance, an anthology of poems is regarded as a work in its own right that makes use of expressions of the individual poems that have been selected and ordered as part of an intellectual process. A new version of an aggregate work does not make the resulting complex work an aggregate work as well. The inclusion of expressions from a complex work in an aggregation work does not make the aggregation work itself complex.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Aggregation Work

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This class comprises the immaterial realisations of individual works at a particular time that are regarded as a complete whole. The quality of wholeness reflects the intention of its creator that this expression should convey the concept of the work. Such a whole can in turn be part of a larger whole. Inherent to the notion of work is the completion of recognisable outcomes of the work. These outcomes, i.e. the Self-Contained Expressions, are regarded as the symbolic equivalents of Individual Works, which form the atoms of a complex work. A Self-Contained Expression may contain expressions or parts of expressions from other work, such as citations or items collected in anthologies. Even though they are incorporated in the Self-Contained Expression, they are not regarded as becoming members of the expressed container work by their inclusion in the expression, but are rather regarded as foreign or referred elements. F22 Self-Contained Expression can be distinguished from F23 Expression Fragment in that an F23 Expression Fragment was not intended by its creator to make sense by itself. Normally creators would characterise an outcome of a work as finished. In other cases, one could recognise an outcome of a work as complete from the elaboration or logical coherence of its content, or if there is any historical knowledge about the creator deliberately or accidentally never finishing (completing) that particular expression. In all those cases, one would regard an expression as self-contained.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Self Contained Expression
owl:Class.skos:definition: This class comprises the immaterial realisations of individual works at a particular time that are regarded as a complete whole.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Any agentive Object , either physical or social. In the context of the POSTDATA ontology network it will mostly refer to organisations or persons
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Agent

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The CreatorRole class models the role that an agent plays with respect to the creation or authorship of a work. In this sense, it has specific properties that are important for the study of authorship of poetic works. These properties are: penName - It is common for authors to use an alias isAnonymous - In many of the works, especially the older ones, the author is not known and this is an aspect that should be considered. isWrongAttribution - Sometimes, especially in older works as well, attributions of authorship have been made that are not correct, but this fact is considered an important aspect for scholars of the subject. typeofDesignation, which is the type of name or designation used, e.g. pseudonyms, heteronyms, etc.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Creator Role

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An abstract work that contains more than one Poetic Work. An Ensemble might be conceived as a collection of works, organized by author, by book song, by book of poems; or as a work mainly written in prose that contains more than one poetic pieces (each one of them being its own Poetic Work). For example, Les fleurs du mal
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Ensemble

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Something that happens or takes place. It is generally mentioned in the text (Redaction) and represented using isMentionedin property. This class is defined as a subclass of edm:Event. In the future, it may be also defined as a subclass of schema:Event or bibframe:Event, so as to facilitate linking with existing entities already defined according to schema.org or those available in knowledge graphs such as the one from the US Library of Congress.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Event

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An ordered list of text units with a given length and indexed elements. Examples of these lists are the list of stanzas and the list of lines, associated to a Redaction.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Ordered Text Unit List

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Named collection of people regarded as a single unit. Typical examples include institutions such as ‘UNED’ or ‘the BBC’ and businesses such as ‘Google’ but also racial or ethnic groupings or political factions where these are regarded as forming a single agency such as ‘the Carthaginians’ or ‘the Communists’. This class is defined as a subclass of pdcore:Agent (which is a subclass of edm:Agent) and foaf:Organization, following the design principles used in the EDM ontology. In the future, it may be also defined as a subclass of schema:Organization, so as to facilitate linking with existing entities already defined according to schema.org.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Organisation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A human being regarded as an individual. This person may have existed in real life (e.g., Miguel de Cervantes) or may be fictional (e.g., Don Quijote de la Mancha). This class is defined as a subclass of pdcore:Agent (which is a subclass of edm:Agent) and foaf:Person, following the design principles used in the EDM ontology. In the future, it may be also defined as a subclass of schema:Person, so as to facilitate linking with existing entities already defined according to schema.org
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Person

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A particular position, point, or area in space; a location This class is defined as a subclass of edm:Place. In the future, it may be also defined as a subclass of schema:Place and geonames:Feature, so as to facilitate linking with existing entities already defined according to schema.org or available in the GeoNames knowledge graph.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Place

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Abstract concept of an artistic creation. In the POSTDATA ontology network these creations must be in verse (e.g., poem, play, song). For example, Os Lusíadas by Luis Vaz de Camões; La Commedia by Dante; the poem Ad te deus by an Anonymous author written in between the 7th and 9th centuries.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Poetic Work

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Representatives of a work, that is, of a Poetic Work. Each version and edition of a work is its own redaction. Eg.: The palaeographic edition of A solis ortu usque ad occidua preserved in Lat. 1154 (BNF) and its critical edition are two Redaction of the same Poetic Work
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Redaction

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This class relates a work (e.g., poetic work, redaction, other transmission elements) and an Agent (Person or Organisation), and allows specifying the role that the agent plays in such work (e.g., creator, sponsor, editor)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Role

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Text unit of an ordered list. For example, a word, a line or a stanza.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Text Unit
Agent
owl:Class.skos:definition: This class comprises people, either individually or in groups, who have the potential to perform intentional actions for which they can be held responsible.
owl:Class.skos:example: Leonardo da Vinci, the British Museum, W3C

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Event
owl:Class.skos:definition: An event is a change "of states in cultural, social or physical systems, regardless of scale, brought about by a series or group of coherent physical, cultural, technological or legal phenomena" (E5 Event in CIDOC CRM) or a "set of coherent phenomena or cultural manifestations bounded in time and space" (E4 Period in CIDOC CRM)
owl:Class.skos:example: the act of painting Mona Lisa
the change of custody of Mona Lisa
owl:Class.skos:note: Events are identified either by the content provider or by Europeana enrichment at ingestion time

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Place
owl:Class.skos:definition: An "extent in space, in particular on the surface of the earth, in the pure sense of physics: independent from temporal phenomena and matter" (CIDOC CRM)

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Provided CHO
owl:Class.skos:definition: This class comprises the Cultural Heritage objects that Europeana collects descriptions about.
owl:Class.skos:note: This class has been mostly motivated by the need to assign a type to the “central node” in the EDM pattern, during the ingestion process, related to the XML expression of EDM at that stage. It was especially intended to fit the cases where edm:PhysicalThing cannot be used as the type of the resource standing for the real-world object (independently of any specific data contributor perspective).

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The Organization class represents a kind of Agent corresponding to social institutions such as companies, societies, etc
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Organization

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The Person class represents people. Something is a Person if it is a person. We don't nitpic about whether they're alive, dead, real, or imaginary. The Person class is a sub-class of the Agent class, since all people are considered 'agents' in FOAF.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Person

owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Thesaurus about labels of a time frame for grouping certain works
Thesaurus about major literary genre of the compositions
Thesaurus about specific function performed by some agent on a work
Thesaurus about literary movements or schools of an author
Thesaurus about the socialstatus of a person
Thesaurus about type of textual element

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The end date and time of the item (in ISO 8601 date format).
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: endDate
